programme.title: Bloomberg Investigates
programme.desc: Brazil's largest bank robbery; at the heart of the brazen heist is South America's most dangerous gang and its raid on what's is known as the Night of Terror.

programme.title: The David Rubenstein Show: Peer to Peer Conversations
programme.sub-title: Cal Ripken Jr. Hall of Fame Baseball Player and MLB Owner
programme.desc: Financier and philanthropist David Rubenstein talks with his peers who leaders of some of America's biggest companies.

programme.title: Bloomberg Originals
programme.desc: Experts offer bold takes on some of today's most important topics and cover stories and investigations at the intersection of business and culture.

programme.title: Bloomberg Wall Street Week
programme.desc: A weekly program telling the stories of capitalism from around the world, David Westin in New York hosts.

programme.title: Bloomberg Next Africa
programme.desc: A monthly deep dive into Africa's biggest stories through a Bloomberg lens. Global investors see the continent as one of the top areas for opportunity and growth, and some African nations are well-positioned to be global hubs for development. This show will discuss key steps taken to help deliver on Africa's quest of bridging the gap with global powers, and track capital flows and the direction of funds amid the underlying political, economic and social developments.

programme.title: Best of the Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg
programme.sub-title: Best of the Qatar Economic Forum, Powered by Bloomberg
programme.desc: Bringing together some of the world's most influential financial and economic thinkers, policy makers and business leaders to prepare a blueprint for the next stage of global growth.

programme.title: The Deal With Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly
programme.sub-title: Principles With Bill Belichick and Ray Dalio
programme.desc: Alex Rodriguez and Jason Kelly sit for a special conversation with two titans, football coach Bill Belichick and Bridgewater founder Ray Dalio, to learn their guiding principles for success.

programme.title: Bullish: Why Wall Street Is Going South
programme.sub-title: Bullish: Why Wall Street Is Going South
programme.desc: There's been a migration of financial powerbrokers to South Florida in recent years, drawn by the weather, light regulation and low taxes. It's hard to imagine the capital of finance leaving NY, but Wall Street South is getting bigger every day.

programme.title: Bullish With Sonali Basak
programme.sub-title: The Gambler's Edge on Wall Street
programme.desc: Wall Street pros often play poker, chess, blackjack and other games that rely on skills that are highly transferable to their work; the lines between finance and gaming are blurring faster than ever.

programme.title: Bloomberg Chief Future Officer
programme.desc: Chief Financial Officers now play a critical role in shaping corporate strategy and positioning organizations; profiling AT&T CFO Pascal Desroches, who has partnered with John Stankey to restructure the company.

programme.title: Bloomberg Tech Summit
programme.desc: Leaders from across technology and business discuss how to navigate today's hazards and create opportunities; guests include Google's Sundar Pichai, Meta's Andrew Bosworth, Uber's Dara Khosrowshahi and Agility Robotics's Peggy Johnson.

programme.title: Bloomberg Wall Street Week
programme.desc: A weekly program telling the stories of capitalism from around the world, David Westin in New York hosts.

This show will discuss key steps taken to help deliver on Africa's quest of bridging the gap with global powers, and track capital flows and the direction of funds amid the underlying political, economic and social developments.

programme.title: Bullish With Sonali Basak
programme.desc: Building wealth used to follow a formula, but these days it's easier than ever to play the markets. With investing tools at everyone's fingertips, is it a chance for generational wealth or a siren call for suckers?

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Lawyer Alex Spiro discusses how he navigates the high-stakes world of litigation on behalf of famous clients like Elon Musk, Jay-Z, Megan Thee Stallion and Alec Baldwin.

programme.title: The Circuit
programme.desc: Emily Chang goes inside Stargate, an historic $500 billion bet on the future of AI; she speaks with OpenAI CEO Sam Altman and Softbank CEO Masayoshi Son about their hopes for the project.
